Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with an off-white deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink and one line of cord-marked decoration.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393239) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393239)
